Reason: The configuration option 'max_hint_window_in_ms' in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact system performance. This configuration determines the maximum time window for which hints about failed writes are kept before being discarded. A higher value can lead to increased memory consumption and potentially slower write performance, while a lower value can result in faster write performance but may increase the likelihood of data loss in case of node failures. Therefore, any change in the 'max_hint_window_in_ms' configuration can have notable variations in system performance, making it performance-sensitive.
